Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: we are going back to what money was for the longest time

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: IOY btw people living in the same space and capable of enforcing the deal (most of the time)

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: money was a oral of written contract btw a debtor and creditor

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: well KSB is going back to that

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: at stage 1, KSB is backed by $ cash and paper money (T-bill) and asset backed loans

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: 1 KSB = $1 = cash $ X + secured debt $ Y

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: what is also interesting to us is the use of KSB

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: KSB checks all the functions of money

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: unit of mesure, of credit, storage, etc...

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: interesting, so there is no underlying crypto asset right? since it's backed by Cash and loans denominated in fiat?

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: Nope directly, you have an indirect exposure as the loans are backed by crypto assets collateral.

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: the risk is close to 0% as the collateral need to be at all time above 125%

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: failing to comply = liquidation

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: right, i read about that yesterday. But what happens if the crypto loans faulted? I understand the 125% covers the offset but that would be like depositing 125 dollars  to create 100 usable dollars.

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: Loans are reimburses

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: or the crypto assets crashed?

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: great question

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: so you can borrow up to 40% of the $ value of your deposited crypto assets

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: crypto can from there drop up to 50%

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: in that case you are at 80% of your collateral

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: every time you got above this limit the delta btw 80 and what is above get liquidated

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Do you have a whitepaper. I'd love to read more about it. I've been doing alot of research on stable coins recently. It's an interesting subject.

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: there is one

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: sending it to you

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: I am happy to talk work with you on the matter

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: ok thanks, send it over to ptyx@chainzilla.io or just pm me

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: top thank you

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: please feel free to chat with me anytime

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: i'll come back with some more questions once i understand it more üòÑ

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: stablecoin is a big thing for our ecosystem

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: not just as a hedging solution

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Yes i agree, stable coins are something of big interest for me.

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: but to develop a valuable safe ecosystem

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: job creations merchand adoption etc

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: I was pointing this in my Wishes above

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: üòÉ

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I look forward to seeing it in action

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: thank you, please don't hesitate on feedback and if you feel like putting sometime building this with us, you are more than welcome. the team keep 0 token

Author: Fab√ò#8941
Content: we designed it and launched it but we do not keep free KSB token

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's actually 2 confirmations

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 1  means "confirmed or notarized with 1 conf" while 2 means "notarized with 2 confs", so in theory, exchanges could lower their confirmation requirements to 2

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/dPOW-conf.html

Author: StrHika#9192
Content: Hello! I have my Komodo on a Ledger hardware wallet, and I missed out on the news that Ledger would disable support for Komodo following the Dec 15 hard fork. So my question is; is there any way to transfer my Komodo out from my Ledger without using Ledger Live (which now has no support for Komodo)? Thanks in advance

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Use your seed in agama to get the private key to the address that holds your KMD, then you can move it from Agama

Author: StrHika#9192
Content: Do you mean the 12-word passphrase from the Ledger? I tried to import it in Agama, but it didn't work. Is there a different seed you mean?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @StrHika  Here is a guide that can help you with your ledger funds if you need to access them https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000026860-komodo-sapling-upgrade-important-info-for-ledger-users

Author: StrHika#9192
Content: @Hermes Great, thanks a lot for the info. I'll read through.
